title: 1930 FA Charity Shield
text:
The 1930 FA Charity Shield was the 17th <a href="FA%20Community%20Shield">FA Charity Shield</a>, an annual <a href="association%20football">football</a> match. It was played between <a href="Arsenal%20F.C.">Arsenal</a> (<a href="1929%E2%80%9330%20FA%20Cup">1929–30 FA Cup</a> winners) and <a href="Sheffield%20Wednesday%20F.C.">Sheffield Wednesday</a> (<a href="1929%E2%80%9330%20Football%20League">1929–30 Football League</a> champions) at <a href="Stamford%20Bridge%20%28stadium%29">Stamford Bridge</a> in London on 8 October 1930. Arsenal won the match 2–1.
Match.
Arsenal took the lead through Hulme, and doubled their advantage before half-time when Jack scored. Sheffield Wednesday scored a consolation goal when Burgess converted a penalty awarded for a Jack handball, and the match ended 2–1.
